  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "",
  "description": "Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains &amp; oilseeds, animal feed &amp; protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains &amp; seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)&nbsp;Area Sales Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers

Job Summary


	We are looking for a dynamic go-getter to lead the sales efforts in the region. You must have an eye for detail, the ability to set and drive aggressive sales targets and a strong ability to build performance cultures within your team.
	The profile involves setting objectives to achieve the top and bottom-line results of the region as per the business plan within the defined budget.
	You will plan and drive the distribution and coverage objectives set for the year and develop and retain a high-performance oriented team.
	The incumbent would also be called to plan and execute sales promotional &amp; market development activities and ensure that any new product launches and sales distribution objectives are met.


Key Deliverables
Strategic Effectiveness:


	Strong planning skills, building the regional sales plan as per the organizational distribution segment strategy.
	Building and driving the quarterly sales and revenue targets, ensuring regional sales objectives are achieved.
	A keen eye on performance, managing ground activities as per plans and objectives and taking remedial action in cases of deviations.


Operational Effectiveness:


	Be the centre of the action, control and guide sales and distribution activities within the region.
	You would have strong market connects, identify and report competitor activities within the region. Plan the necessary actions to counter them and to protect your market share.
	Build strong relationships with the distribution channel, co-ordinate for field requirements and support distributors.


Organizational Effectiveness:


	Be the people person, the one-point source of motivation and guidance for the diverse and often large local teams across country/region.
	Plan and execute product training, team development activities and build a robust performance culture within the team.


Requirements


	A flair for sales, numbers should be like second nature to you.
	MBA with 3 - 5 years of post-qualification industry experience.
	Good knowledge of the region and its geography and demographics.
	Prior experience in sales and distribution required.


Click here to apply online

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

2.)&nbsp;Assistant Production Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilorin, Kwara

Job Description


	The Production Manager should execute the approved plan to meet the production volume, quality, and safety standards for Hazardous plant.
	Coordination with maintenance department to execute Preventive maintenance plan and minimize the process break downs.
	Coordination with Safety Manager for all regarding safety involving production and maintenance issues.
	Aligns with Technical team and Plant Manager for improvement/modification follow up, as well as sharing process variables, issues, recommendations, etc to ensure safe operation.


Key Deliverables


	Accountable for safety in the Production department. He/she will ensure production team and process comply with safety regulations and norms.
	Align with the plant&rsquo;s the Plant Manager and ensure implementation of production plan and related actions to meet volume and quality targets for oil and meal.
	Organize with shift in charge, details of material intakes in time as per production plan and to monitor oil storage area to ensure oil transfer in time with confirmation of correct quantity and quality.
	Ensure all the daily and monthly reports for production, consumptions of utilities as well as for maintenance down time will be ready in time for submission to the Plant Manager.
	Coordinate with Maintenance Manager to execute all preventive maintenance plans and spare parts procurement.
	Monitor daily maintenance report and coordinate with Maintenance to ensure optimum performance and minimize plant downtime.
	Ensure continuous development of all team members, training, coaching, encouraging, and has considered especially for Hazardous plant, to monitor and compliance to HSE, GMP, to maintain and improve internal process control, environmental management, food and employee Safety.
	Investigate plant operations problems, analyze the proposal of modifications from shift supervisors and assist Plant manager in its implementation for smooth operations.
	Develop and periodically review plant SOP&rsquo;s to maintain healthy operation and ensure compliance to every elated standard.
	Coordinate with logistic &amp; Engineering departments to ensure minimum stock of plant consumable.


Requirements


	Engineering Degree, preferably Chemical or Mechanical Engineering.
	Minimum 10 years as Production / Process Manager in large Solvent Extraction Plants of &gt;1000Tons per day.
	Experience with modern solvent extraction technology is an added advantage.


Click here to apply online

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

3.)&nbsp;Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) Manager

Job Location: Ilorin, Kwara

Description


	The EHS head will be responsible for the implementation of Olams EHS policies across the 25 tier 1 manufacturing plans in Africa.
	The incumbent must have a detailed understanding of all the applicable laws and regulatory guidelines form the EHS perspective for all the plat locations.
	The role requires cross-functional co-ordination as many of the locations do not have dedicated EHS resources.
	For Olam environment is a priority and you will be the driver of our efforts to reduce our carbon footprint.
	As the EHS Head, you will drive the legal compliance and the safety conscience of the organization along with the following key dimensions


Key Deliverables
Strategic Effectiveness


	Draft and publish a safety manual detailing the basics of Olam&#39;s EHS policy and procedures.
	This should incorporate applicable regulatory guidelines.&nbsp;
	Design a robust audit system comprising of policy/management/system/infrastructure/process/practice regarding EHS.
	Give inputs to project teams during greenfield/brownfield projects to build in EHS compliance during design stage itself
	Audit project sites for compliance of EHS guidelines and work with project teams to enable compliance
	Coordinate with relevant agencies to ensure compliance to all governing laws


Operational Effectiveness


	Bring out new/unknown risks in new and existing facilities for management to act
	Ensure all Olam facilities are compliant to local/international regulatory norms
	Document areas of improvement, push the envelope when it comes to environmental safety and safe workplace practices
	Identify opportunities to eliminate not just reduce workplace hazards


Organizational Effectiveness


	Undertake and document audits based on the published audit criterion. Work independently for the audits or constitute cross-functional audit teams to conduct effective audits.
	Follow up on action plans on identified gaps as brought out during audits
	Coach and train plant EHS personnel to develop them as EHS leaders in their plants
	Undertake training of plant personnel to ensure safety requirements and the right knowledge is transferred to the lowest level in the plant operations


Requirements


	Engineering Degree in Mechanical / Electrical / Chemical
	Total of 10-15 years of industry experience
	Initial experience in maintenance/projects in a large manufacturing set-up will be preferred.
	At least five years of experience in leading the EHS function of a large corporation in national/regional role
	Ability to network, excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and people skills.
	Ability to persevere and stay focused in the face of priority conflict with a peer group
	Leverage key stakeholders to move the EHS agenda forward.

title: Job Openings at Rainoil Limited
content:
Rainoil Limited is an integrated downstream oil and gas company. A prominent player in the Nigerian industry, the company’s operations span across the downstream value chain i.e. Petroleum Product Storage, Haulage/Distribution and Retail Sales. Our primary products include Petrol (PMS), Diesel (AGO) and Kerosene (DPK).

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) IT Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	To manage and maintain the network infrastructure of Rainoil, as well as the acquisition, installation, maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of computer hardware devices
	To manage all software applications running on the hardware devices and ensure that they provide adequate support to Rainoil in order to achieve set objectives.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Provides robust IT platforms and infrastructure to support Rainoil Logistics business operations.
	Assists in implementing IT strategies, policies, and procedures
	Plans, designs, and maintains data networks and servers
	Provides technical support to users on network issues
	Administers day-to-day operations of networks and servers
	Implements LAN/WAN maintenance and management procedures.
	Establishes and maintains user accounts, profiles, file sharing, access privileges on the company intranet
	Installs, supports, and maintains both physical and virtual network servers and appliances
	Oversees the day-to-day operation of computer networks within Rainoil Logistics
	Liaises with the Internet Service Providers and other vendors for cost effective services in line with Service Level Agreements
	Maintains computer peripheral equipment such as scanners, printers and ensures that these are prepared and ready to be used
	Assists the Team Lead, Information Technology in the deployment of computer hardware around the company
	Manages relationship with service providers to ensure seamless, cost effective and hitch free internet connectivity
	Maintains logs and records of daily data communication transactions, problems, and remedial actions
	Provides support and maintenance to the business’ software and applications
	Installs client/server applications and essential software patches, carries out any required maintenance of applications and identifies compatibility issues, escalating appropriately
	Supervises and performs hands on training for computer users and operators.
	Develops and executes company-wide disaster recovery and business continuity plans with respect to software, data, and applications
	Performs the addition, removal and updates of staff data and access rights in line with the information security policy.


Requirements


	Qualification: B.Sc/HND in Computer Science/Computer Engineering or related course. Minimum of Second Class Upper.
	Experience: 2-5 years of experience as an IT Officer.


Application Closing Date: 26th July, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Team Lead, Helpdesk

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities


	Microsoft Power Platform: Skilled in Power Apps (Canvas & Model-Driven), Power Automate, Virtual Agents.
	Dataverse: Managing tables, relationships, security roles, and data policies.
	Environment Management: Creating, configuring, and maintaining Power Platform environments.
	Security & Permissions: Handling user roles, security groups, DLP policies, and conditional access.
	Governance & Compliance: Establishing naming conventions, data classification, and auditing policies.
	App Lifecycle Management (ALM): Managing app deployment using Power Platform pipelines, Azure DevOps, and Git.
	Monitoring & Analytics: Utilizing Admin Center, CoE Starter Kit, and Compliance Center for performance and usage insights.
	Troubleshooting: Diagnosing and resolving app, flow, connector, and access issues.


Responsibilities


	Power Apps & Power platforms
	Technical support & Issue resolution
	User Support Training
	Hardware & Software Management
	Network & Connectivity support
	System monitoring & Maintenance
	Documentation & Reporting
	IT Policy Enforcement
	Collaboration & Escalation


Requirements
Experience:


	3–5 years of hands-on IT support experience.
	At least 1–2 years in a supervisory or lead role in a helpdesk or IT support


Process & Governance Knowledge


	Familiarity with ITIL processes (incident, request, problem management).
	Understanding of asset management, access control, and cyber hygiene.
	Experience conducting regular team reviews and performance reporting.


Application Closing Date: 26th July, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Procurement Officer is responsible for sourcing and purchasing goods and services essential to the organization’s operations. This includes evaluating suppliers, negotiating contracts, and ensuring cost-effective procurement in line with quality and delivery standards.


Responsibilities


	Source and procure goods and services in line with company policies and budget.
	Evaluate and monitor supplier performance to ensure compliance with contractual obligations.
	Negotiate price, terms, and conditions of purchase agreements with vendors.
	Liaise with internal departments to understand procurement needs and specifications.
	Ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements in procurement activities.
	Assist in the development and implementation of procurement strategies.
	Prepare and process purchase orders and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
	Maintain accurate records of purchases, pricing, and inventory.
	Monitor stock levels and place orders as needed.
	Conduct market research to identify pricing trends and new suppliers.


Requirements


	Minimum of second class upper bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Proven experience as a Procurement Officer or in a similar role.
	Strong negotiation and communication skills.
	Knowledge of procurement software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Good analytical and strategic thinking abilities.
	Familiarity with sourcing and vendor management.


Application Closing Date: 22nd Augusr, 2025.

Click here to apply online

General Manager (GM) Job at Seflam SGL Limited




        
    

        
        Seflam SGL Limited is an indigenous provider of Engineering, Procurement, Construction and Installation (EPCI) services in West Africa with over 17 years experience servicing Oil and Gas majors including ExxonMobil, Chevron, Total and Shell. Our mission is to help our Clients achieve the highest level of safety, quality and valued added results at optimal cost in the execution of our Projects.

We invites qualified and experienced and competent professionals to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager (GM)

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The General Manager (GM) provides strategic leadership and operational direction for the successful planning, execution, and delivery of all EPCI (Engineering, Procurement, Construction, and Installation) projects.
	The GM is responsible for business growth, compliance with regulatory and local content requirements, and alignment of company objectives with performance excellence in safety, quality, and client satisfaction.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Project Management, Business Administration, or related fields (master's degree preferred).
	Minimum of 12 years of experience, with at least 8 years in executive/senior management roles in the EPCI or oil & gas industry.
	Proven track record of delivering large-scale projects within time, budget, and quality expectations.
	Sound knowledge of the Nigerian Oil and Gas Industry Content Development (NOGICD) Act.
	Strong financial and business acumen with budget development and P&L (Profit and Loss) management experience, including the ability to analyse financial reports, develop cost-effective strategies, monitor key financial indicators, and drive sustainable profitability.
	Expertise in project lifecycle management, contracting, and regulatory compliance.
	Demonstrated commitment to health, safety, and environmental excellence. Excellent leadership, organizational, and communication skills.
	Negotiation and stakeholder management skills.
	Strong technical knowledge and ability to interface with engineering teams. Proficiency in project management software and Microsoft Office Suite.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their resume to: recruitment@seflamsgl.com and stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmb.gov.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
